ticket.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding
ticket.original-body:
On a vanila Rails 3 beta1 app as well as on edge, when you generate a scaffold based upon an uncountable word you'll get a routing error. That's what I did: rails g scaffold fish name:string When going to http://localhost:3000/fish/new, I'll get: 
ActionController::RoutingError in Fish#new
Showing (...)/app/views/fish/_form.html.erb where line 1 raised:
No route matches {:action=>"destroy", :controller=>"fish"}

Extracted source (around line 1):
1: <% form_for(@fish) do |f| %>
The same happens for sheep (which, like fish, obviously is included in the active support inflector defaults) or other uncountable words I put in the inflection initializer. I also get a warning when running the generator: Plural version of the model detected, using singularized version. Override with --force-plural. Adding that option fixes the warning, but not the generated code.

I also get a warning when running the generator: Plural version of the model detected, using singularized version. Override with --force-plural. Adding that option fixes the warning, but not the generated code.

On a vanila Rails 3 beta1 app as well as on edge, when you generate a scaffold based upon an uncountable word you'll get a routing error.

That's what I did:
rails g scaffold fish name:string

When going to http://localhost:3000/fish/new, I'll get:

Extracted source (around line 1):

The same happens for sheep (which, like fish, obviously is included in the active support inflector defaults) or other uncountable words I put in the inflection initializer. I also get a warning when running the generator:
Plural version of the model detected, using singularized version. Override with --force-plural.

Adding that option fixes the warning, but not the generated code.

On a vanila Rails 3 beta1 app as well as on edge, when you generate a scaffold based upon an uncountable word you'll get a routing error.

rails g scaffold fish name:string

ActionController::RoutingError in Fish#new

Adding that option fixes the warning, but not the generated code.
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body:
I can confirm this bug. fish_url and fish_path will also raise
No route matches {:action=>"destroy", :controller=>"fish"}
The following...
resources :fish, :singular => :fish_instance
does not generate fish_instance_path and fish_instance_url as it did in Rails 2.3.5. Is there a work-around until this is fixed?
version.body-html:
I can confirm this bug. fish_url and fish_path will also raise

No route matches {:action=>"destroy", :controller=>"fish"}

The following...

resources :fish, :singular => :fish_instance

does not generate fish_instance_path and fish_instance_url as it did in Rails 2.3.5. Is there a work-around until this is fixed?
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body: This seems to be a routing issue rather then problems with scaffolding. I'm bumping into the same problem
version.body-html: This seems to be a routing issue rather then problems with scaffolding. I'm bumping into the same problem
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body: The attached patch should add _index to the uncountable resource (like it did in 2.3.5). This is only a partial solution to the scaffolding problem, but solves my problem with routes.
version.body-html: The attached patch should add _index to the uncountable resource (like it did in 2.3.5). This is only a partial solution to the scaffolding problem, but solves my problem with routes.

version.body: (from [cf6734fdf9d72bfc7fe92e36bf603d67ad815e6b]) Add more tests and docs to uncountable routes. [#3930 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/cf6734fdf9d72bfc7fe92e36bf603d67ad815e6b
version.body-html: (from [cf6734fdf9d72bfc7fe92e36bf603d67ad815e6b]) Add more tests and docs to uncountable routes. [#3930 state:resolved] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/cf6734fdf9d72bfc7fe92e36bf603d...

version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body:
I'm experiencing this same problem on Rails 3 beta 4. I have the following route: resources :research I receive the following error: ActionController::RoutingError in Research#new No route matches {:action=>"destroy", :controller=>"research"} Extracted source (around line #1): 1: <%= form_for @research, :as => :research do |f| %> 2: <% if @research.errors.any? %> 3:
4:

<%= pluralize(@research.errors.count, "error") %> prohibited this research from being saved:

Is there a way to resolve this, or is it still an ongoing bug?
version.body-html:
I'm experiencing this same problem on Rails 3 beta 4. I have the following route:

resources :research

I receive the following error:

ActionController::RoutingError in Research#new
No route matches {:action=>"destroy", :controller=>"research"}
Extracted source (around line [#1](/projects/8994/tickets/1 "Ticket #1")):

1: <%= form_for @research, :as => :research do |f| %>
2:   <% if @research.errors.any? %>
3:     <div id="error_explanation">
4:       <h2><%= pluralize(@research.errors.count, "error") %> prohibited this research from being saved:</h2>

Is there a way to resolve this, or is it still an ongoing bug?
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body-html:
@Throlkim It works for me with latest master.

rails generate scaffold research title:string
rake db:migrate
rails server
# visit http://localhost:3000/researches

I am able to visit index page and am able to create a new research.
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body: @Neeraj, Did you set it up as uncountable? My route is http://localhost:3000/research :) I'm running the latest master too, as of last night methinks.
version.body-html: @Neeraj, Did you set it up as uncountable? My route is http://localhost:3000/research :) I'm running the latest master too, as of last night methinks.
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body:
Definitely still broken. Followed the steps laid out in #4898 and see the same problem. The problem is that polymorphic_url is mapping to the :show action for that form_for, when it should be mapping to the :create.
Possibly because it's matching /fish/:id, when it should be matching /fish/new?
version.body-html:
Definitely still broken. Followed the steps laid out in #4898 and see the same problem. The problem is that polymorphic_url is mapping to the :show action for that form_for, when it should be mapping to the :create.

Possibly because it's matching /fish/:id, when it should be matching /fish/new?
version.title: Uncountable inflections lead to exception with Rails 3 scaffolding

version.body: Okay, here's a patch that should fix this issue.
version.body-html: Okay, here's a patch that should fix this issue.

version.body:
(from [ed3f042e99949526f483d1f567e40031deea33d3]) Make polymorphic_url and scaffolding work with uncountable resources [#3930 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/ed3f042e99949526f483d1f567e40031deea33d3

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.
